cab.content: (This Telegram is the property of His Britannic Majesty's Government and should be returned to the Offices of the War Cabinet for transmission to the Colonial Office when done with unless required for official use.)TELEGRAW from the Secretary of State for the colonies to tho Governor General of New Zealand.(Sent 6*15 p.m. 13th heceiribcr, 1918). Your telegram 14th November. Hie Iajesty'sGovernment in view of objections expressed by your government and altering Market conditions decided toabandon proposal outlined in my telegram of November 12thand have telegraphed to South Africa authorising UnionGovernment to invite South African Farmers register saleof their individual Wool Clips at 55/. above 1913-14 prices with eventual right to receive one-half of any profitswhich may be realised on re-sale. This arrangement isidentical with the offer made to South Africa in October1917 and His Majesty1s Government hone that your government will now be completely satisfied.12LONG.
